title: Created a symbolic link to a security certificate, now Firefox will not open webpages, nor open its preferences tab
content:
...and I don't receive any error messages. I've made sure it wasn't just my selected homepage. I tried other major cites like CNN.com, Amazon.com, etc. I just see a blank tab. However if I use Chromium (I run the latest LTS release of LinuxMint w/ Xfce desktop) websites open just fine.

I was attempting to configure a symbolic link to a security certificate so that I could run Schwab StreetSmart via Citrix Workspace via the directions given here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59905065/using-schwab-streetsmart-edge-cloud-on-linux-citrix-error

This is the command I ran: sudo ln -s /usr/share/ca-certificates/mozilla/DigiCert_Global_Root_G2.crt /opt/Citrix/ICAClient/keystore/cacerts/DigiCert_Global_Root_G2.pem

I then rebooted as the instructions say and when the system came back up I opened up FireFox and I wasn't able to access any sites. Also when I click on the drop down menu and click on "Preferences" in FireFox nothing happens. No error messages.

I even tried removing and reinstalling FireFox, it didn't help. I'm at a loss.
creator: djlepin

creator: the49rs

title: Podivné chování FF při zobrazování stránek.
content: Zdravím všechny. Už si nevím rady, mám FF88/64bit na Win7/64 Pro, noťas HP G7000. Problémy jsou dva a předem prosím, odpovědi typu přeinstaujte si FF, restartujte v nouzovém režimu, popř upgradujte na Wokna 10 si ušetřte. Už jsem zkusil znovu naistalovat FF (ovšem po něm v registrech zůstalo úplně všecko, tudíž přeinstalace je sporná), dokonce naformátovat HDD, vše naistalovat znovu, včetně platného Nod32, pořád se to stává. První problém je v tom, že některé stránky (naposledy Microchip) se po několika kliknutích zblázní, dokonale se roztrhá skladba stránky, zůstane jen obrovský psaný text bez fontů a ikonka obnovení/zastavení načítání začne bláznivě měnit symbol otočné šipky na x rychlostí asi 10x za sekundu. Nahoře se objeví nějaké příkazy čtečce (?!), jako zatrhávací políčka, ale nic z nich nefunguje. Zbývá stránku jen totálně na několikerý pokus zavřít, nebo sestřelit FF ze Správce, když se ani to nepodaří... Stává se to náhodně v čase i prostoru (tedy na různých stránkách a vždy po náhodné době). Doufám, že alespoň toto stihnu dopsat. Druhý problém je v tom, že se mi náhodně po stisku klávesy (teď to bylo obyčejné "M"), objeví v dolní části ladící okno. Dá se zavřít, ale je to otravné a netuším, jak se toho zbavit. Díky za případnou pomoc a uvítám někoho, který má podobné zkušenosti.
creator: bd7421d1

title: I can no longer access a specific website only from the Firefox desktop
content:
Hi, Since 2-3 days, I can no longer access a specific website (before all was fine, and I still have access to others website without issue). It's only from Firefox desktop, from Firefox android it works, from Edge or Chrome too (on same computer). Same issue on my laptop (with previous firefox version and latest). It's a "loading error", maybe "time out" ("Le délai d’attente est dépassé" in french).

I tried to do the things suggested in help, as: _delete cookies and cache _check proxy config (not used) _enable "network.dns.disableIPv6" and "network.dns.disablePrefetch" _disable extensions (also tried debug mod)

Also tried the 'ipconfig /flushdns', before seeing that same issue on the laptop. I use Avast, but I don't think it's because of him.

Any idea please?

title: Unable to use several websites; all show the same error - NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED
content:
Starting last week (with the 88 update?), I've had problems using several sites that I have to login to. It started with Outlook (Office 365), but now includes Zendesk and even the Firefox Account. In the case of Outlook, I got an error message. For Zendesk, I can log in but the page doesn't render. On the FF Account page, I get a message saying cookies and local storage aren't enabled, though they are.

In all cases, there's an 'Uncaught exception...NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED...' error in the console. I got outlook working by using localStorage.clear() and sessionStorage.clear() in the console, but it was a temporary fix.

I've disabled all extensions to no avail. Some of these sites work in FF safe mode (hence logging in to write this), but Outlook is unresponsive.

What's going on? Is there a fix?

title: certificate exceptions for server via "certificate management" not working
content: I added a few exceptions for internal servers with self-signed certificates via Settings->Security->Show Certificates->Server->Add Exception (permanent exceptions). But these exceptions do not prevent the certificate warning on first connect, after restarting firefox I always need to allow a exception for all of these servers (I have mutiple tabs with monitoring / management sites for some servers open). How to get rid of the warning ? (I can't use let's encrypt certificates on the server, because the server have no internet connection.). Additional: In the german version of the certificate management dialog are certificate name ("Zertifikatsname") and server name ("Servername") column headings (or data) exchanged, the "certificate name" column shows the server name and vice versa.

title: Firefox accesses Solidworks fonts folder
content:
Hi, lately I have been trying to tackle my secondary HDD being spun up for no reason in the background and one thing that keeps popping up is Firefox.exe accessing a bunch of fonts contained in the Solidworks installation on the HDD (which is a secondary drive, while Firefox is installed on the primary SSD).

I really cannot understand why it happens, since I think nobody is supposed to install Solidworks along with Firefox. Of course I don't want this activity to wake up my drive, but also, is it normal? I have to admit I'm kinda worried.

I'll attach screenshots from Sysinternals Process Monitor

Thanks in advance to anyone that will help :)

title: Problema com mecanismo de pesquisa: potencial problema de segurança
content:
Boa noite! Então, estou tendo problemas em pesquisar termos no Google pela barra de pesquisa. O Firefox alega "Não conectou: Potencial problema de segurança", mas, dando uma lida nas informações do erro, percebo que há escrito:

[...] O Firefox não confia neste site porque ele usa um certificado que não é válido para www.google.com. O certificado só é válido para os seguintes nomes: www.google.com.br, *.google.com.br, google.com.br

E, então, mudei a url da barra de pesquisa de google.com (que o mecanismo de pesquisa adiciona automaticamente) para google.com.br e funcionou. Pois bem, quero mudar o mecanismo de pesquisa para que ele adicione o ".br" automaticamente, mas não consigo achar onde e nem como. É possível?

Grato.
creator: mateushirt000

title: Firefox developer tools response garbarge
content:
Hi, I'm having an issue with Firefox developer tools response in the network tab. When I look at the response it's all garbage but when I look at it in Chrome or Charles proxy it looks fine.

To replicate: 1. Go to https://www.realestate.com.au/new-homes/ 2. Open up developer tools, switch to network tab and filter by .mst 2. On the webpage click `Explorer` sub menu item 3. Inspect the response of the .mst requests and it's garbage like: PHN0eWxlIHR5cGU9InRleHQvY3NzIj4uc3RhbmRhcmRfX3N0YW5kYXJkLWNvbnRhaW5lcl9fXzFGVFJ3e21heC13aW
creator: george1319

title: Won't open certain pdf files and crashes
content:
Firefox v88.0.1 on Win 10 Pro 20H2 PC, Windows Security (Windows Defender). All fully up-to-date.

This problem only started recently: When link is clicked in FF to open certain pdf files, a new, fully formatted FF window opens, but the body is blank white and the pdf never loads. Doesn't happen with all pdf files listed on the "referring" page, but just some of them on a certain well-known and trusted web site, and it's very reproducible.

Setting FF to open pdf files in Adobe Reader doesn't help. Same ones open but the others still won't. Other people tell me they have no problems opening those pdf files in FF.

I completely uninstalled and re-installed FF but that didn't help. Doesn't matter how I set the security/privacy options, have Ghostery on or off (only extension installed). Use recommended performance settings is enabled, DNS over HTTPS is off, tracking protection can be standard or strict, etc.

If I click Manage Exceptions under Enhanced Tracking Protection, there's no way to enter any exceptions so I can't exempt the website in question.

If I keep trying to open one of those pdf files, FF becomes totally unresponsive. Task Manager lists ~4-5 FF entries but I can't End Task for most of them, and I typically have to reboot PC. Windows creates a firefox.dmp file which says: FAULTING_THREAD: 000012f8 PROCESS_NAME: firefox.exe ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0x80000003 - {EXCEPTION} Breakpoint A breakpoint has been reached. EXCEPTION_CODE_STR: 80000003

I've run out of things to try...

Any ideas ?

Thanks!
creator: rohe1318
